paragraph.paragraph: Compiling projects, often referred to as ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconprojectbuilds.htmBuilding in Visual Studio .NET is the process of compiling the Eiffel source files, each containing an ../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlEiffel class declaration, and creating an assembly. The assembly generated from a build can be executed as a stand-alone application or used from another application.

The EiffelEnvision project build process is broken down into three stages:
Pre-Build Tasks
Main Compilation
Post-Build Tasks

Pre-Build Tasks
During this stage of the build, EiffelEnvision prepares the project and your system for the Main Compilation.

Main Compilation
In this stage, the Eiffel compilation will be started, compiling your project's Eiffel code into an assembly. An extra task to unmanaged_code.xmlcompile the unmanaged code may be performed based on your ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/index.xmlProject's Configuration and what has been compiled by Eiffel for .NET compiler.

Post-Build Tasks
After the main compilation has succeeded, the post-build actions will be performed. In this stage, EiffelEnvision is preparing the project for execution using the ../debugging/index.xmlDebugger or for external execution.

EiffelEnvision presents two modes of compilation; incremental and optimized. Incremental compilation has the advantage of building projects faster as the Eiffel compiler will only build the changes made to the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/index.xmlProject Configuration or any of its Eiffel source files. For incremental compilations, the Eiffel for .NET compiler will generate multiple assembly modules, instead of a single assembly module containing the assembly manifest. Optimized compilation attempts to make compile-time optimizations and is therefore much slower than the incremental compilation. Optimized compilation, in contrast, generates a single assembly module containing the assembly manifest and all of the ../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlEiffel classes included in a project. You may change the configuration specific ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmloptimize_codeOptimize Code property from the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlBuild Project Properties. Setting the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmloptimize_codeOptimize Code property to No will instruct the compiler to use incremental compilation, whereas Yes will ensure the compiler optimizes the compilation of your project.
Tip: When compiling projects using incremental compilation, you can tweak the compilation further using the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlclasses_per_moduleClasses Per Module configuration property also from the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlBuild Project Properties. This property dictates how many Eiffel classes the compiler should put into each incremental assembly module. Lower numbers reduce compilation time for large systems, but increase start-up time; higher numbers decrease start-up time but increase compilation time.

The process of building a project contained within a ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconSolutions.htmSolution is governed by the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconBuildConfigurations.htmBuild Configuration. Although most builds will be performed using the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconBuildConfigurations.htmBuild Configuration, you may also selectively build a single project contained within the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer. For more information, please refer to the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskprepareandmanagebuilds.htmPreparing and Managing Builds documentation.

EiffelEnvision projects present three modes of building a project:
Build
Rebuild
Clean

Build
In this build mode, EiffelEnvision project(s) will be built as fast as possible, taking into consideration the changes to the project and its configuration. If EiffelEnvision does not detect any changes to the project, the main compilation will be skipped. EiffelEnvision may also deem it necessary to perform a Rebuild instead of a Build to ensure the changes to the project or its configuration are reflected. Those ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/index.xmlProject Properties that will trigger a Rebuild when changed are marked as such in the property descriptions.
Note: Projects whose ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/general.xmloutput_typeOutput Type property is set to Precompiled will perform a Rebuild instead of Build. This is the nature of precompiled libraries. EiffelEnvision is smart enough to know not to build any precompiled projects contained within a solution unless they absolutely require a build.

Rebuild
This build mode will force a fresh compilation. All attained and generated incremental compilation information will be discarded and project(s) will be built as if for the first time.

Clean
Clean building works in contrast to Build and Rebuild in that is does not generate, but cleans. This build mode removes any incremental compilation information for the project(s) selected, and removes all compiled assemblies and other binaries generated as a result of one or more builds.

Building one or more projects in the same session may be done using either the project's context menu options or through using the Build main menu. Instructions for building a single project or an entire solution may be found in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskprepareandmanagebuilds.htmPreparing and Managing Builds documentation.

Alternatively, you may ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskPrepareandManageBuilds.htmBuild, ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskprepareandmanagebuilds.htmRebuild, or ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskPrepareandManageBuilds.htmClean projects and solutions from the command-line using devenv and its ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxgrfcommandlineswitches.htmCommand Line Switches
